alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 3:30AM MDT until April 05 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches below 5500 feet, to include McCall and Cascade. Above 5500 feet total accumulations of 3 to 8 inches with up to 12 inches across higher peaks. The snow will mix with or change to rain below 5500 feet during the afternoon, but will change back to all snow Monday night. Winds gusting to 45 mph in mountain valleys with gusts to 55 mph at higher elevations in the afternoon and early evening. * WHERE...West Central Mountains and Boise Mountains zones. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially over mountain passes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and power outages are possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
